001package io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.components.toggle;
002
003import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.selenium.smart.SmartWebElement;
004import org.openqa.selenium.By;
005
006/**
007 * Represents a toggle switch in a UI automation context.
008 * Provides methods to activate or deactivate the toggle, and to check if it is enabled
009 * or currently activated.
010 *
011 * <p>Implementations typically use Selenium-based interactions with container elements
012 * ({@link SmartWebElement}) or direct locators ({@link By}). Whether toggles are styled
013 * like classic checkboxes or custom toggle switches, this interface provides a standard
014 * contract for testing or simulating user interactions.
015 *
016 * <p>This interface can handle toggles identified by text, container references, or direct
017 * locators, making it flexible for a wide range of UI designs.
018 *
019 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
020 */
021public interface Toggle {
022
023   /**
024    * Activates the toggle identified by text within the specified container.
025    *
026    * @param container  the container holding the toggle.
027    * @param toggleText the text identifying the toggle to activate.
028    */
029   void activate(SmartWebElement container, String toggleText);
030
031   /**
032    * Activates the toggle identified by text without referencing a container.
033    *
034    * @param toggleText the text identifying the toggle to activate.
035    */
036   void activate(String toggleText);
037
038   /**
039    * Activates the toggle identified by a locator.
040    *
041    * @param toggleLocator the locator referencing the toggle to activate.
042    */
043   void activate(By toggleLocator);
044
045   /**
046    * Deactivates the toggle identified by text within the specified container.
047    *
048    * @param container  the container holding the toggle.
049    * @param toggleText the text identifying the toggle to deactivate.
050    */
051   void deactivate(SmartWebElement container, String toggleText);
052
053   /**
054    * Deactivates the toggle identified by text without referencing a container.
055    *
056    * @param toggleText the text identifying the toggle to deactivate.
057    */
058   void deactivate(String toggleText);
059
060   /**
061    * Deactivates the toggle identified by a locator.
062    *
063    * @param toggleLocator the locator referencing the toggle to deactivate.
064    */
065   void deactivate(By toggleLocator);
066
067   /**
068    * Checks if the toggle, identified by text within a container, is enabled.
069    *
070    * @param container  the container holding the toggle.
071    * @param toggleText the text identifying the toggle to check.
072    * @return true if the toggle is enabled, otherwise false.
073    */
074   boolean isEnabled(SmartWebElement container, String toggleText);
075
076   /**
077    * Checks if the toggle, identified by text, is enabled without referencing a container.
078    *
079    * @param toggleText the text identifying the toggle to check.
080    * @return true if the toggle is enabled, otherwise false.
081    */
082   boolean isEnabled(String toggleText);
083
084   /**
085    * Checks if the toggle, identified by a locator, is enabled.
086    *
087    * @param toggleLocator the locator referencing the toggle to check.
088    * @return true if the toggle is enabled, otherwise false.
089    */
090   boolean isEnabled(By toggleLocator);
091
092   /**
093    * Checks if the toggle, identified by text within a container, is currently activated.
094    *
095    * @param container  the container holding the toggle.
096    * @param toggleText the text identifying the toggle to check.
097    * @return true if the toggle is activated, otherwise false.
098    */
099   boolean isActivated(SmartWebElement container, String toggleText);
100
101   /**
102    * Checks if the toggle, identified by text, is currently activated without referencing a container.
103    *
104    * @param toggleText the text identifying the toggle to check.
105    * @return true if the toggle is activated, otherwise false.
106    */
107   boolean isActivated(String toggleText);
108
109   /**
110    * Checks if the toggle, identified by a locator, is currently activated.
111    *
112    * @param toggleLocator the locator referencing the toggle to check.
113    * @return true if the toggle is activated, otherwise false.
114    */
115   boolean isActivated(By toggleLocator);
116
117}
